definition: To legally take someone else's child into one's own family and raise them as one's own, typically involving a formal legal process. This term is commonly used to describe the act of becoming the legal parent of a child who is not biologically related to the adoptive parent(s).

examples.english: I want to adopt a child.

examples.german: Sie haben beschlossen, ein Haustier zu adoptieren.
examples.english: They have decided to adopt a pet.

examples.german: Die Familie hat das Baby aus einem Waisenhaus adoptiert.
examples.english: The family adopted the baby from an orphanage.

examples.german: Er wurde als Baby von einer liebevollen Familie adoptiert.
examples.english: He was adopted as a baby by a loving family.

examples.german: Sie hat sich entschieden, ein Kind aus dem Ausland zu adoptieren.
examples.english: She has decided to adopt a child from abroad.
